title: Senators want to revive dormant probe on Bolsonaro’s Covid response
description:
Brazil’s recently sworn-in prosecutor general, Paulo Gonet, had promised senators who confirmed his nomination that he would conduct investigations on Brazil’s Covid response during the Jair Bolsonaro years (2019-2022), recommended by a 2021 Senate investigation.  Months into Mr. Gonet’s two-year term, allies of the Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva administration want to cash into his […]

The post Senators want to revive dormant probe on Bolsonaro’s Covid response appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: IDB revises Brazil’s growth projection in 2024 downwards
description:
The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), the largest development institution in Latin America and the Caribbean, revised its projections for the region’s growth to 1.6 percent this year.  In the case of Brazil, expectations were reduced from 1.8 percent to 1.5 percent, that is, below the region’s average expansion. The same would happen in the following […]

The post IDB revises Brazil’s growth projection in 2024 downwards appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Racial identification gaffe reopens debate on Brazil’s university quota system
description:
Two multiracial students applying for places reserved for non-white candidates were knocked back by the University of São Paulo, sparking confusion and outrage among society

The post Racial identification gaffe reopens debate on Brazil’s university quota system appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
